item.title: Indonesian Crash Searchers Recover Black Boxes From Plane
item.description: Low-lying clouds and rugged terrain on Tuesday were hindering efforts to remove bodies from the crash site by helicopter, officials said.
item.dc:creator: JOE COCHRANE

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: War Movie Posters Mocked for the Mao Who Wasn’t There
item.description: Posters for a new Chinese movie on the Cairo Declaration, the 1943 statement by Allied leaders that laid out the goal of defeating Japan, have touched off online ridicule because they feature Mao Zedong, who did not attend.
item.dc:creator: AUSTIN RAMZY

item.title: Koreas Agree to Raise Minimum Wage at Joint Industrial Park
item.description: The countries agreed to an increase in the minimum wage at a jointly run industrial park in the North Korean border city of Kaesong, South Korean officials said.
item.dc:creator: CHOE SANG-HUN
item.media:description: An apparel factory in the Kaesong industrial park in North Korea. The complex, where 53,800 North Koreans work at 124 factories run by South Korean managers, is one of the last vestiges of cooperation between the two countries.

item.title: Bangkok Bomb Attack at Popular Shrine Kills at Least 20
item.description: The blast appeared to be the worst by far in a series of explosions that have disrupted the country since the military seized power in May 2014.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS FULLER
item.media:description: Investigators on Monday evening at the Erawan Shrine, a Hindu site in Bangkok’s main shopping area that is popular with both Thais and foreign tourists.

item.title: Former President Concedes, Then Reverses, in Sri Lanka
item.description: Mahinda Rajapaksa said he was unlikely to lead Sri Lanka’s next government as results were still being tallied Tuesday morning in Colombo.
item.dc:creator: DAVID BARSTOW

item.title: Former President Concedes, Then Reverses, in Sri Lanka
item.description: Mahinda Rajapaksa said he was unlikely to lead Sri Lanka’s next government as results were still being tallied Tuesday morning in Colombo.
item.dc:creator: DAVID BARSTOW

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Q. and A.: Qiu Xiaolong on His Novel ‘Shanghai Redemption’
item.description: In Qiu Xiaolong’s new novel, “Shanghai Redemption,” Inspector Chen Cao finds himself once again enmeshed in political struggles partly influenced by the real-life downfall of Bo Xilai, the party chief of Chongqing.
item.category: Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (Communist Party of China)
item.dc:creator: EDWARD WONG

item.title: Indonesians Find Plane and 54 Bodies Days After Crash
item.description: Rescue teams reached the crash site of a commercial aircraft that went down over the weekend and found all 54 bodies, officials said.
item.dc:creator: JOE COCHRANE
item.media:description: Relatives of a passenger on board the missing Trigana Air Service flight providing information to police officers on Monday at the airport serving Jayapura, Indonesia, where the plane took off.

item.title: Religion Meets Rebellion: How ISIS Lured 3 London Girls
item.description: An online culture that blends youthful rebellion with radical religiosity helped draw popular, high-achieving friends to Syria.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: KATRIN BENNHOLD
item.media:description: Images from recordings at Gatwick Airport show, from left, Khadiza Sultana, Shamima Begum and Amira Abase passing through security before flying to Turkey.

item.title: U.N. Finds Its Voice on Syria’s ‘Transition’
item.description: The Council managed to adopt a modest statement, while sidestepping what to do about President Bashar al-Assad.
item.dc:creator: SOMINI SENGUPTA

item.title: World Briefing: Malaysia: Seeking to Curb Social Media
item.description: Malaysia will ask three social media and Internet companies to curb content in the interest of public safety.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: Mile Mrksic, a Serb Army Officer Convicted of War Crimes, Dies at 68
item.description: Mr. Mrksic was serving a 20-year prison sentence for his part in the 1991 killings and torture of more than 200 people during the Balkan wars.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: France: Search for Malaysia Flight 370 Debris Cut Back
item.description: France will reduce its search for debris from the missing jet after a 10-day hunt off the island of Réunion in the Indian Ocean turned up nothing new.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Iraq: Monitoring Group to Investigate Possible Chemical Weapons Use by ISIS
item.description: The group responsible for monitoring adherence to the global ban on chemical weapons said that it had contacted Iraq over reports of the possible use of such munitions there.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: World Briefing: Philippines: Americans Are Found Dead
item.description: The bodies of an American and his Filipino-American wife were found in a well in the central Philippines in a case suspected to be linked to robbery.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Open Source: Syrian State TV Edits Out Criticism From Visiting U.N. Official
item.description: Syrians who rely on state television for their news missed harsh words about the conduct of forces loyal to President Bashar al-Assad.
item.dc:creator: ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Shake-Up in Moscow as Railways Chief, a Putin Friend, Is Reported Ousted
item.description: It was not clear if sanctions imposed after the annexation of Crimea played a role in the reported removal of Vladimir I. Yakunin as director of Russian Railways.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW E. KRAMER

item.title: Off the Coast of Iran, a High-Stakes Version of Spy Versus Spy
item.description: As American naval ships roam the waters along Iran’s coastline, Iranian fighter jets patrol the skies watching them in what sometimes seems like a high-risk game.
item.dc:creator: HELENE COOPER
item.media:credit: Adam Ferguson for The New York Times
item.media:description: On the flight deck of the carrier Theodore Roosevelt after a mission. "When they launch, we launch," an American officer said.

item.title: Police Officers Are Killed at a Checkpoint in Afghanistan’s South
item.description: Officials said the attack, in which the assailant used his cousin to gain access before poisoning and shooting the officers, was the third of its kind in Helmand Province in less than two weeks.
item.dc:creator: TAIMOOR SHAH and MUJIB MASHAL

item.title: Palestinian Man Fatally Shot in Confrontation With Israeli Police
item.description: The man, identified by the police as Mohammad Abu Amsha, 26, was the third Palestinian to try to stab Israelis in the West Bank since Saturday.
item.dc:creator: DIAA HADID
